itemDescription: British tennis player of greek origin, resident in Egypt

wikipedia_page.main: Dimitrios written also as Demetrius (Greek: Δημήτριος) Kasdaglis written also as Casdagli(s) (Greek: Κάσδαγλης), (10 October 1872 in Salford – 1931) was a Greek-Egyptian tennis player. He competed in the 1896 Summer Olympics in Athens and the 1906 Intercalated Games, also in Athens.In certain sources his first name has been erroneously cited as Dionysios (Greek: Διονύσιος).
